intro: Tatea herbacea, commonly known as the slender tatea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters at the base of the stems. Tatea herbacea is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native environment, supporting various insect and bird species.
